org.cirdles.string.api

Class StringResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cirdles.string.api.StringResource

  • @Path(value="string")
 @Consumes(value="text/plain")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
public class StringResource
extends java.lang.Object
    A resource is a collection of related HTTP endpoints. This class is a resource comprised of string operations.

    Each method in this class corresponds to a single endpoint. Each endpoint's path is a combination of class and method Path annotations (i.e. "string/reverse" from @Path("string") on this class and @Path("reverse") on the method reverseString(String)). Paths maybe also be influences by the web.xml and the resource's container (i.e. Jetty or Tomcat). Each endpoint's HTTP verb is specified by its method's DELETE, GET, POST, or PUT annotation.

    Endpoints should also specify expected and provided media types. These are given using the Produces and Consumes annotations. An endpoint's set of media types comes from both its method's and its class's annotations.

    Notice that this class's only imports are from the package javax.ws.rs. This package provides the Java API for RESTful Web Services (JAX-RS). JAX-RS is an interface for specifying web resources. In this project, it is implemented by Jersey, the reference implementation for JAX-RS. Jersey connects to its resources through src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/web.xml.

    This resource delegates it logic to StringService. Doing this makes this class more readable and makes the logic quickly and easily testable. It is recommended that other projects follow this pattern as a best practice.

    See Also:
    Jersey User Guide, StringService
